instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-1521: What is 820-1521? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_G3S: What is PP5V_G3S? PP5V_G3S is a 5v power rail present when the system is in a G3S standby state.
definitions.PP3V3_G3H_RTC: What is PP3V3_G3H_RTC? PP3V3_G3H_RTC Is one of the first rails that has to come on in order for the USB-C mux chip to be powered in the T2 chip Macbook Pros..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-1521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Dead Stuck at 5v
threads.message:
So I got an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-1521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> in today - completely dead no sign of liquid anywhere. No damage visible - the machine is stuck at 5V on both ports. PPBUS is 12.31 <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL> is present. <SIGNAL>PP5V_G3S</SIGNAL> and its associated enable is missing. Awake and Sleep voltages are also all missing. Not detected at all when I try to force DFU Mode. No visible shorts on any of the awake or sleep lines.

Still very new at these boards but i've run through everything on the wiki but cannot see anything directly pointing to my issue other than possible dead <CHIP>U7800</CHIP>? Am I thinking along the right lines? Is there any good source for <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> or I just need to find dead boards?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-1521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Dead Stuck at 5v
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-1521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Dead Stuck at 5v
threads.message: No output from any of the LDO's out of <CHIP>U7800</CHIP>. Also no lines shorted.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-1521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Dead Stuck at 5v
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-1521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Dead Stuck at 5v
threads.message: After waiting a couple weeks for <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> from china received today fitted and machine working normally again. Wish there was a better source for these chips than having to wait weeks from china though!
